CatDescriptText: Mr. Leonard J, Lindsey, hotel worker, McKees Rocks and Mr. Fred Woodberry, railroad office worker, Hill, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1962, pg. A3  with question: "Should relief payments to unemployed persons be increased?" Mr. Lindsey's answer reads: "Yes.  I think payment should be in keeping with the cost of living."  Mr. Woodberry's answer reads: "That's a broad question.  For some people, yes, and for some no.  Under certain circumstances, it would be all right to give them more if they used the money for the prupose for which it was presented, but some ...it.  I'd go half-way on that question."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Leonard J. Lindsay wearing plaid coat and fedora, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Fred Woodberry wearing flecked coat and fedora, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
